Question: How can I calculate the sum of an array in Java?
Please using this api: Arrays.stream.
Answer:<<<api>>>: Arrays.stream
<<<code>>>: int[] array = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5};
int sum = Arrays.stream(array).sum();
<<<explanation>>>: The sum() method of the IntStream class returns the sum of elements in this stream. This is a special case of a reduction. This is a terminal operation.
Question: Hashing a password before form submission on Server: :Below function use in JavaScript(forms.js include) for hashing a password.Whats is the equivalent in JAVA,function formhash(form, password) {      console.log("Hashing form");      // Create a new element input, this will be our hashed password field.      var p = document.createElement("input");      // Add the new element to our form.      form.appendChild(p);      p.name = "p";      p.type = "hidden"      p.value = hex_sha512(password.value);      // Make sure the plaintext password doesn't get sent.      password.value = "";      // Finally submit the form.      form.submit();    }
